title: Whales in an Ocean — Ocean
text: dimensions vector length two giving dimensions ocean. males list R6 objects class Male containing current population male whales. females list R6 objects class Female containing current population female whales. malePop Current number males population. femalePop Current number females population. starveParameter Helps determine probability whale die starvation current generation.

title: Whales in an Ocean — Ocean
text: Ocean$distance() Ocean$new() Ocean$starvationProbability() Ocean$advance() Ocean$plot() Ocean$clone()

title: Whales in an Ocean — Ocean
text: dims numerical vector length 2 giving dimensions ocean males either numeric vector length 1 giving initial number male whales, list R6 objects class Male inheriting Whale.  former, specified number whales class Male instantiated, certain default characteristics.  latter, given whales cloned. females either numeric vector length 1 giving initial number female whales, list R6 objects class Female inheriting Whale.  former, specified number whales class Female instantiated, certain default characteristics.  latter, given whales cloned. starve starvation parameter

title: Whales in an Ocean — Ocean
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(ggplot2) oceanSim <- function(   steps = 100, males = 10,   females = 10, starve = 5,   animate = FALSE, seed = NULL   ) {  if ( !is.null(seed) ) {    set.seed(seed)   }   ocean <- Ocean$new(dims = c(100, 100), males = males,                      females = females, starve = starve)   population <-numeric(steps)   for ( i in 1:steps ) {     population[i] <- ocean$malePop + ocean$femalePop     if ( animate ) ocean$plot()     if ( population[i] == 0 ) break     ocean$advance()     if ( animate ) {         ocean$plot()         Sys.sleep(0.5)       }   }   pop <- population[1:i]   df <- data.frame(time = 1:length(pop),                   pop)   ggplot(df, aes(x = time, y = pop)) + geom_line() +     labs(x = "Time", y = "Whale Population") } oceanSim(seed = 5050) } # }

title: Whales in an Ocean — Whale
text: R6 Objects modelling whale.  Female Male inherit whale.  Use Female Male  want provide custom lists male female whales instantiate ocean.

title: Whales in an Ocean — Whale
text: Object R6Class methods simulation. Boolean sex resulting baby

title: Whales in an Ocean — Whale
text: position numeric vector length 2 giving  initial position.  (Make sure within dimensions ocean.) age initial age whale lifespan lifespan whale range Distance female can detect eligible male. maturity Age whale reproduction possible. stepSize Number units whale moves generation.

title: Whales in an Ocean — Whale
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ initialMales <- vector(mode = "list", length = 10) ages <- c(rep(3, 5), c(rep(10, 5))) for (i in 1:10) {   initialMales[[i]] <- Male$new(     position = runif(2, min = 0, max = 100),     age = ages[i],     lifespan = 40,     range = 12,     maturity = 10,     stepSize = 7   ) } initialFemales <- vector(mode = "list", length = 10) for (i in 1:10) {   initialFemales[[i]] <- Female$new(     position = runif(2, min = 0, max = 100),     age = ages[i],     lifespan = 40,     maturity = 10,     range = 12,     stepSize = 3   ) }  library(ggplot2) oceanSim <- function(   steps = 100,   males = 10,   females = 10,   starve = 5,   animate = FALSE,   seed = NULL   ) {  if ( !is.null(seed) ) {    set.seed(seed)   }    ocean <- Ocean$new(     dims = c(100, 100),     males = males,     females = females,     starve = starve    )   population <-numeric(steps)   for (i in 1:steps) {     population[i] <- ocean$malePop + ocean$femalePop     if (animate) ocean$plot()     if (population[i] == 0) break     ocean$advance()     if (animate) {       ocean$plot()       Sys.sleep(0.5)      }   }   pop <- population[1:i]   df <- data.frame(     time = 1:length(pop),     pop    )   ggplot(df, aes(x = time, y = pop)) +     geom_line() +     labs(x = "Time", y = "Whale Population") } oceanSim(males = initialMales, females = initialFemales, seed = 5050) } # }

what: Extract Portions from R Help Files for Use in Documents — helpExtract
title: Extract Portions from R Help Files for Use in Documents — helpExtract
text: Extracts specified portions R help files use Sweave R-markdown documents.

title: Extract Portions from R Help Files for Use in Documents — helpExtract
Extract Portions from R Help Files for Use in Documents — helpExtract
text: Function function extracting help file . section section want extract. Defaults "Usage". type type character vector want returned. Defaults "m_code". See Details ... arguments passed getHelpFile.

title: Extract Portions from R Help Files for Use in Documents — helpExtract
text: character vector used Sweave R-markdown document.

title: Extract Portions from R Help Files for Use in Documents — helpExtract
text: type argument accepts: "m_code": use markdown documents instances highlighted code expected, example "Usage" section. "m_text": use markdown documents instances regular text expected, example "Description" section. "s_code": use Sweave documents instances highlighted code expected, example "Usage" section. "s_text": use Sweave documents instances regular text expected, example "Description" section. insert chunk markdown document, use something like: ```{r, echo=FALSE, results='asis'} cat(helpExtract(cor), sep = "\n") ``` insert chunk Sweave document, use something like: \Sexpr{knit_child(textConnection(helpExtract(cor, type = "s_code")), options = list(tidy = FALSE, eval = FALSE))}

title: Extract Portions from R Help Files for Use in Documents — helpExtract
text: Reproduced helper functions defined R source, ::: calls.

title: Extract Portions from R Help Files for Use in Documents — helpExtract

title: Building Random Trees — make_val_tree

title: Building Random Trees — make_val_tree

title: Building Random Trees — make_val_tree
text: min_children Minimum number children node leaf. max_children Maximum number children node leaf. min_depth Nodes less specified depth leaves. values Numerical vector possible values associate node. fillcolor Fill color nodes. fontcolor Fonot color text showing node value node name. seed Option set random seed.

title: Volume of Users of a Rail Trail — railtrail
Volume of Users of a Rail Trail — railtrail
text: data frame 90 observations following variables. hightemp daily high temperature (degrees Fahrenheit) lowtemp daily low temperature (degrees Fahrenheit) avgtemp average daily low daily high temperature (degrees Fahrenheit) season spring, summer fall cloudcover measure cloud cover (oktas) precip measure precipitation (inches) volume estimated number trail users day (number breaks recorded) weekday logical indicator whether day non-holiday weekday dayType one "weekday" "weekend"

title: Volume of Users of a Rail Trail — railtrail
Volume of Users of a Rail Trail — railtrail
text: Pioneer Valley Planning Commission (PVPC) collected data north Chestnut Street Florence, MA ninety days April 5, 2005 November 15, 2005. Data collectors set laser sensor, breaks laser beam recording rail-trail user passed data collection station. potential error two users trigger infrared beam exactly time since counter logs one crossings.  collectors left motion detector winter, counter drops data temperature falls 14 degrees Fahrenheit, data cold winter months.
